business.full_address:
106 East Liberty
Downtown Ann Arbor
Ann Arbor, MI 48104
business.name: Viva La Diva Events

reviews.text: Allison from Viva La Deva Events was my wedding planner. We hired her to coordinate our rehearsal and day-of. Allison went above and beyond and did a great job. She was very good at making sure everything ran smoothly, and in helping us plan the big day without hiccups. During the event we ran out of prosecco (horrors!) and Allison ran out to get more. She is a really nice, professional, punctual person and I would recommend her for your event planning needs.

Professional and easy to work with! They really strive to personalize your event and incorporate your design and taste!  They are flexible in how much you want to delegate to them and you can honestly trust them to help make your event planning stress-free!  Especially in design aspects, they really work to make a cohesive look and are mindful of details that you might forget if you were planning it yourself!  Personally, for my wedding, they were really invested and wanted to make my event the best it could be!  I would highly recommend!

business.full_address:
1116 Westwood Blvd
Westwood
Los Angeles, CA 90024
business.name: Boba World

reviews.text: Boba world is such a great place for good PHO and boba! They're pretty good for large parties (I remember attending many student organization meetings and having lunch afterwards here at Boba World). They make their boba pretty well (never too hard or soft) and you can never go wrong with Thai Iced Tea w/ Boba. This place is ALWAYS busy because the food is GOOD!  Can't wait for my next trip to Boba World.

Boba World was my first boba experience.  I enjoyed it then and I enjoy it now.   I have never been disappointed with any flavors I have gotten, but my favorite will always be the taro smoothie.  

It's a great dessert to have once you've eaten a dinner somewhere in Westwood.  The portion easily fills you up, and if you find any uneaten tapioca balls at the bottom of your cup, just use your straw and fire them babies out.
Great BOBA!!  OK food.  Gotta go for the boba!!  :)

I came here one night to get some after dinner Boba.  I got to tea places often so i kinda know what the normal standard for tea should be.  I ordered a Almond milk tea which seems like should be fairly common fair at a tea house.  It was easily the worst tea i had ever drank.  The tea it self tasted like water.  Barely any almond flavor.  It was supposed to be milk tea but it tasted like they had just mixed the almond flavor into water and called it quits.  The Boba had terrible consistency.  Tasted like oddly hard jello.  Not good at all.  I took two sips hoping it would get better on the second one.  When it didn't i threw it out.  There has to be better Boba then this in the area.

I walked here last night with my dear hubby who is fasting and in the mood for big portions, greasy food, lots of flavor and a high-calorie drink. (I would be too if I hadn't eaten or drank anything all day). It was my first time. First off, note that they only take cash - that can be a problem for people like me who use credit all day, every day.

The restaurant is casual, but they still insist on waiting to be seated and having wait staff take your order. I found this a little weird, but whatever. The menu was very extensive and is a mix of thai, chinese, and vietnamese. We didn't have trouble finding two entrees that would satisfy.

We started with a Thai Iced Tea with Boba. It was good, but overpriced! I think it cost us $3.25. Now, maybe this is the going rate in Westwood, but back when I was a college student Boba was never more than $1.25... sheesh.

I got the Pan-Fried Spicy noodles with Chicken, he got the Beef Yakisoba. Both were decent. Too much oil!!! How  hard is it to reduce the amount of oil so I don't feel like I'm eating noodle soup?

It's hard to complain about the taste - very good. Spicy enough. Nice mix of fresh veggies and meat. Overall, I liked it. I think I would return if I am ever in the mood for greasy, greasy americanized Asian food. Someone please tell me if there is cheaper Boba nearby.

One of the few places you can satisfy your boba craving in Westwood, at least when I was there. It's a big pricey, especially since I've been spoiled by 98 cent bobas in the San Gabriel Valley, but it's good. It's also within walking distance for students on campus.

this used to be like the only place you could get boba on this side of town... this was before all the lollicups and the i love bobas and the volcano teas, etc.

now they're just whatever. i haven't been there in a long long time. in fact, i only get boba from there if im mistakingly eating at noodle planet.

gone are those days.
Have the Japanese green tea latte with boba- delicious and I'll take it over a Starbucks (or Coffee Bean) any day. I only wish there was one here in Chicago since I moved out of LA!

BEWARE OF SLOW SERVICE! We ordered a couple of bobas from the front register, and it took them more than 15 minutes to bring us the teas (I timed it, as I had the parking meter running out front and had to put more coins in to avoid a ticket). And when they FINALLY brought out the drinks, they had gotten the order wrong. When I told them it was mixed up, the waitress rolled her eyes and acted mad that I wouldn't just take what she had made, even though it was wrong. Terrible service and the longest wait for boba ever = skip this place! There are plenty of other places to get good boba in Westwood.
